data.author: Naval Ravikant
data.title: I kind of feel like every moment is a death. You can't go back to the past; no one's ever gone back even a second. I don't even remember what I said two minutes ago.
paragraphs: Living in the past and clinging on to memories and images tortures us.
Say you have an encounter with someone and you have a pleasant conversation. An image of that person is now formed in your head - that person is pleasant and polite.

The next time you see the person they pretend to not see you they ignore you and carry on walking. You are hurt the image that you formed is shaken and it stirs you up inside. Your little belief wasn't correct and it affects your whole day.
So we can see that the images we build up in memory from past events cause us strife.

If we could rid ourselves of these images which are just memories stored in the brain would we then not get offended or anxious fearful? Is it possible to not form these images or to remove them from memory?
I think this is actually the whole problem. You see that images and memories are causing you problems so you now want some system or some meditation guru to tell you how to remove them.
You want someone to give you the answers. That is replacing your old beliefs systems and ideas with new ones. New beliefs that will be shaken in the future and cause you more pain.

When you discover that these images - thoughts that judge and condemn - are the source of all your troubles and that trying to replace these thoughts with new systems and beliefs gets you nowhere because you can't get rid of thoughts by thinking. When you see this as true you will instantly stop trying to find new systems. And when you stop seeking you find peace.

This can be difficult to understand. Think about it deeply and be aware of all the thoughts and emotions that arise. This is meditation. It is understanding oneself with full truth direct perception without the mind acting as a filter.

data.author: Eckhart Tolle
data.title: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life.
paragraphs: The past and present are illusions. All you have is the present moment which is changing constantly every second. From present moment to present moment. Nothing is stationary or certain.
Embrace this uncertainty because this is called living. Life would be boring if we knew exactly how everything is going to pan out.
What does it mean to live in the present moment? It means to be content with what is. To not dwell on the past or to seek for a better future.

I think that this way of life comes about through self-understanding total truth and honesty with yourself. By seeing things for what they truly are not through a cloud of thoughts ideals and beliefs which are just made up things.
Everybody has their own little beliefs and ideals it is the source of all conflict. He shouldn't have said that it's totally unacceptable.
But the person who said it will have their own beliefs made up from their own past experiences. So thoughts are not truth. They are made up by people and are subjective.
Truth can only be experienced in the absence of thought. It is a great feeling peace. When you can just see things for what they are it is to be meditative.
To just look at a pretty face or flower and enjoy it without thinking of all the science and history behind it all.

data.author: Naval Ravikant
data.title: Meditation is intermittent fasting for the mind. Too much sugar leads to a heavy body and too many distractions lead to a heavy mind. Time spent undistracted and alone in self-examination journaling meditation resolves the unresolved and takes us from mentally fat to fit.
paragraphs: 2.5 thousand years ago Buddha told us that every comparison brings us suffering. Whenever we compare ourselves to others we are collecting suffering.
Everybody has their own innate unique personality that should be allowed to flourish without external or internal resistance.

Today we sit on our mobile phones flicking through 100s of Facebook statements and pictures that others have carefully constructed. People smiling with their many friends on great vacations with their amazing other halves.
You finish up depressed because you feel you aren't as happy or as successful as these people.

We're also bombarded with headlines and advertisements every day disaster news stories and people outraged on twitter. It distorts our view of the world into something totally inaccurate. All of this isn't real life. It is designed to stir your emotions to keep you watching.

How do you deal with all this nonsense? See it for what it truly is. Made up ideas and carefully constructed images. Has the girl with the beaming smile partying in the Facebook picture got a better life than you or has she got to be up at 7 am for an 8 hour shift with a hangover?
There is no need to wish ill on these people or judge them let them live as they wish. Why should people live the way you think they should? Focus on living your own life.
When you see the reality of social media and the news and that it's detrimental to your health perhaps you will no longer want to use it.
It won't take any effort to quit either. Once you see the truth of something the action becomes effortless. You will just do it.

data.author: Naval Ravikant
data.title: Happiness is that state when nothing is missing. When nothing is missing your mind shuts down and your mind stops running into the future or running into the past to regret something or to plan something.
paragraphs: Focusing on breath Vs letting your thoughts flow.
Focusing on your breath can be a good way to quieten the mind by taking attention away from thoughts. But watching TV listening to music or drinking alcohol can also do this.
I think the problem could be that you never really resolve your thoughts. They are always waiting around the corner.
Sitting with your thoughts and making no effort to escape. Watching them going with them and gaining understanding of how they arise and the emotions they induce can be more beneficial.
It can make you more aware of the fact that your world view is your world.

data.author: Epicurus
data.title: To win true freedom you must be a slave to philosophy.
paragraphs: Imagine waking down a high-street and somebody was talking aloud everything that they were thinking. In 1 hour I need to pick up the kids so I probably just about have enough time to get the shopping in. God look at the size of her how can you live like that? Wish I had those trainers though!

You'd be labelled mad. Yet everybody you walk by in that street has that constant voice in their head. Always running. Replaying clips of painful moments from the past causing a depression or thinking about events in the future that could go wrong resulting in anxiety.
How is this acceptable? Surely this is no way to live.
Excessive thinking is a disease.

data.author: Alice Walker
data.title: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
paragraphs: Thought fuels emotion; emotion fuels thought.
A hostile aggressive thought will create the feeling of anger. The thought is preparing the body to fight.
The root cause is fear - feeling threatened physically or psychologically.
It may be difficult to not act out of overwhelming emotions but if you are present enough in watching them not identifying with them they will not take root.
When you are angry don't focus on the object of your anger - the person that wronged you or the event that didn't go your way. Feel watch explore the sensory reality of the anger itself.
Take a step back and watch carefully when strong emotions arise.

data.author: Naval Ravikant
data.title: You want to rest your mind. You want to learn how to settle into your mind. Now I look forward to solitary confinement. You leave me alone for a day it will be the happiest day I've had in a while. That is a superpower that I think everybody can attain.
paragraphs: We all know the feeling of loneliness. It's like a boredom an urge to be entertained by somebody else by a book or movie or to always be working. An urge to be distracted from the self.
We are afraid to sit with just ourselves for company because deep down we are empty. No light is shining from within.
The next time this feeling arises don't escape from it. Look right at it go with it. If you run away it will only be hiding around the corner to pounce on you again.
This is the beauty of meditation. You have to confront everything as it arises with no escape.

data.author: Marcus Aurelius
data.title: If you seek tranquillity do less.' Or (more accurately) do what's essential--what the logos of a social being requires and in the requisite way. Which brings a double satisfaction: to do less better. Because most of what we say and do is not essential. If you can eliminate it you'll have more time and more tranquillity. Ask yourself at every moment 'Is this necessary?
paragraphs: An important area of stoic thought is to follow the logos. The logos is a term used by stoics that means human nature and the way things work in the universe. The Stoics believe that you cannot control the world around you only how you respond.
They believe that nature gives people rules and guidelines to live in accordance with. This is done by living virtuously.
The four stoic virtues:
Wisdom: to know what is under your control and what isn't.
Temperance: to understand moderation. Knowing what you need and what is excess.
Justice: your actions contribute to the common good.
Courage: to be good and incorruptible under any circumstance.

data.author: Jordan Peterson
data.title: Don't be dependent. At all. Ever. Period.
paragraphs: Nerves or anxiety are caused by living too much in the future. The future being uncertain. Our beliefs are static things conclusions stored in memory that cause us so much grief when reality doesn't conform to them.
You have a presentation to give Monday morning for work. You're well prepared and know the material very well. You know that you will deliver a good presentation. Yet you're still nervous.
You care about what your boss thinks. All your time was dedicated to the presentation itself and zero in attending to your nervousness.

Perhaps you worked so hard on the presentation to distract yourself from your nerves. Perhaps you'll have a drink or watch TV to escape take your mind off it. But it won't be resolved and it will slither its way back.
Other's opinions are not under your control and therefore require none of your attention. What requires attention is your dependence for approval.

Look deeply into your reactions and emotions. See the reality that the opinions of others are not the problem. The problem lies solely within you. Watch your reactions and emotions the thoughts that cause them. Understand and see the truth of it.
Take the time to understand this because when you do you will no longer depend on others.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.title: The way is forever nameless.
paragraphs: Named you are limited; nameless and you are limitless. Before language the world was nameless. What is a tree? Is it its trunk branches and leaves? The roots too? But the tree also needs the sun and soil with nutrients. Perhaps it is all one.
Whenever you catch yourself naming yourself telling yourself a story take a breath and remind yourself that you're are a complex thing that could never be captured with words.

data.author: Herman Hesse Siddhartha
data.title: I have always believed and I still believe that whatever good or bad fortune may come our way we can always give it meaning and transform it into something of value.
paragraphs: You may not be aware just how much your surroundings dictate how you feel.
You can test this out for yourself. Try listening to a sad song whilst paying close attention to how you feel. Then listen to a more upbeat happy tune and again watch closely.
External events and you surrounding can have tiny to huge effects on the way you feel.

The problems arise when thought steps in. An external event may cause feelings of sadness or anxiety. Thought then steps in and you identify with this feeling. I am sick of feeling like this what is wrong with me? I'm gonna have to something about this..
Thoughts add fuel to the anxiety and the feeling perpetuates
The feeling would dissipate had thought not stepped in. When you feel like this don't try to do anything about it. Don't escape from it. Watch the feeling. Really try to feel it. Go with it.
Realise it's natural for different emotions to rise and fall throughout the day. Be aware of your surroundings emotions and thoughts.

data.author: Seneca
data.title: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
paragraphs: Watch your mind. Don't judge it. Don't control it. Just watch it. You can actually meditate 24/7.

Ask for each one does this one serve me anymore? Is this just from some anxiety from the past? Perhaps from when you were ridiculed for your appearance when you were 10 years old and you still carry that insecurity despite it now being pointless.
Work through all of your thoughts. Don't judge them as good or bad but ask does this serve me anymore.
Work through your thoughts.

data.author: Socrates
data.title: An unexamined life is not worth living.
paragraphs: It is easier to act and cooperate effectively when you understand the human mind which is to understand your own mind. Understanding how to deal with your inner fears and prejudices.
The point of meditation is not to escape from reality. It is to get in touch with reality. To observe reality as it is. To explore the mind not merely focus it.
The mind can be focused by watching a good thriller movie. But you will not be observing your minds dynamics.
Watch how your mind wanders. From one thought to the next the feelings that arise. Make no effort to do or stop anything. Meditation should be completely effortless. Let it flow.

data.author: Eckhart Tolle
data.title: All things that truly matter - beauty love creativity joy inner peace - arise from beyond the mind.
paragraphs: We have become slaves to our minds. Everything that the mind says we take to heart we identify with it.

You're sitting in your garden relaxing on a Saturday after a week's work. Your friend Joe is on holiday in Italy. A thought enters saying I'd love to take the wife to Italy we never do anything like that. I should get a better job so I can afford these things but I'm not as smart as Joe.
From these thoughts these random thoughts that just popped into your head you conclude that you are poor unadventurous and unintelligent. All just words. What we truly are lies beyond words.

It is your minds job to feed you with thoughts. Can you watch the thinker - the thing feeding you these thoughts - without becoming them? Can you see the stupidity of identifying yourself with everything that pops into your head?
If you can - see the absolute truth of it - then you will no longer identify with your thoughts.

data.author: Seneca
data.title: To be everywhere is to be nowhere
paragraphs: Try to do too many things in a day or to achieve many goals and you will achieve none.
Don't make your life harder than it needs to be. Seneca says after running over a lot of different thoughts pick out one to be digested thoroughly that day.

data.author: Naval Ravikant
data.title: Desire is a contract that you make with yourself to be unhappy until you get what you want.
paragraphs: A fit body a calm mind a house full of love. These things cannot be bought -- they must be earned.

In any situation in life you only have three options. You always have three options. You can change it you can accept it or you can leave it. What is not a good option is to sit around wishing you would change it but not changing it wishing you would leave it but not leaving it and not accepting it. Its that struggle that aversion that is responsible for most of our misery. The phrase that I probably use the most to myself in my head is just one word: accept.

data.author: Richard Bach Illusions.
data.title: I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.
paragraphs: Illusions tells the story of a Jesus Christ like figure who can perform miracles but quit all of it to ride around in his airplane and sell 10 minute rides for $3.
You are under no obligation to live your life in any way.
Your only obligation in any lifetime is to be true to yourself. -- Richard Bach Illusions

data.author: Helen Keller
data.title: Keep your face to the sun and you will never see the shadows.
paragraphs: Sunlight smiling walking and hugging. All things that release serotonin a neurotransmitter that acts as a light pain reliever and antidepressant.
Depressed people spend too much time in doors thinking caught up in the own heads. Information overload.
Spend more time in nature. Go for long walks be aware of your surroundings. Be aware your thoughts and emotions without trying to control them.
Watch it all like you're watching a movie.

data.author: Seneca
data.title: Without wisdom the mind is sick and the body itself however physically powerful can only have the kind of strength that is found in persons in a demented or delirious state. So this is the sort of healthiness you must make your principal concern. You must attend to the other as well but see that it takes second place.
paragraphs: The stoics strongly believed that the mind should be taken care of over everything else and that this could be done through gaining wisdom and holding close to philosophy each day.

The life of folly is empty of gratitude and full of anxiety - Epicurus (Whilst Epicurus belonged to a different school of thought Seneca believed that what was well said also belonged to him. He wasn't interested in making petty enemies.)
Be gracious and content with what you have. This will rid you of much anxiety and prevent your mind from wandering off into the future seeking for greater things.
Seneca says to continually remind yourself of the many things you have achieved. When you look at all the people in front of you think of all the ones behind you.

data.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
data.title: Freedom from the desire for an answer is essential to the understanding of a problem.
paragraphs: What could be more important than self-understanding? Surely it's not possible to live a good life without it?

Be wary when people give you advice telling you how you should live and what you should do. They are probably telling you more about themselves than you. That advice comes from their experiences memories and beliefs.
Yet everybody seems to look elsewhere outside of themselves for the answers whether it be some psychologist or a friend. You must make the effort to get to know your true self
Nobody else knows what they are doing either. So you may as well follow your own path.

data.author: Marcus Aurelius
data.title: Stupidity is expecting figs in winter or children in old age.
paragraphs: Expectations oppress reality. You start living in an imagined world as opposed to the real one.

Negative expectations cause hardship in the present. It's done to prevent potential hardship in the future if the negative event comes to fruition. Practicing negativity harms you in the present and potentially harms your future.
Positive expectations cause hardship in the future if they don't come to fruition. In holding positive expectations you risk harming yourself in the future.
Positive expectations are better than negative because in the present you are holding a positive futuristic view. But both can hurt you in the future.
It is best however to have no expectations at all. No expectations allow you to live in the present moment and be fully immersed in your experiences. With no fear or looking forward to the future.
Focus on what you can do presently. Realise that you don't have complete control of the future.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.title: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.
paragraphs: Lao Tzu frequently mentions to be like the uncarved block. It means to be simple and to work with your own nature. Not to have a noisy mind full of facts and desires. To not be tarnished by society. It is frivolous to fight ones own nature with cleverness.

Wu wei means to do that which consists in taking no action and order will prevail.. Stop trying to force action and get comfortable with doing less. Peace will come from subtracting from your life not adding to it. Out of peace comes happiness joy.
Then when you do move your actions will be energetic natural and purposeful. Observe the nature of the world: the skies are not always stormy and the birds are not always in flight.
From the sages emptiness stillness arises from stillness action. From action attainment.

Wu wei means to not force it be patient. You can make efforts but don't work yourself into the ground. Not a lot may be happening in your life right now but things will change suddenly. Be patient and don't fight nature.

data.author: Richard Bach Illusions
data.title: If you argue for your limitations they are yours
paragraphs: The only limit is your mind.

data.author: Harry Brown
data.title: When you know that youre capable of dealing with whatever comes you have the only security the world has to offer
paragraphs: Your mind which is made up of your thoughts beliefs conclusions and ideals are all held in memory from past experiences whether that be taught or through events is not truth.
We have discussed in previous meditations that unwavering truth with yourself and others is key to a peaceful mind.
Imagine you were brought up in a different country with a different religion language and traditions.

Your thoughts beliefs and ideals would be much different to what you have. Thus you would behave differently. Perhaps you'd be happier or feel more confident. Maybe you'd be quicker to anger with those beliefs and ideals that tell you the way things ought to be and the way others should behave.
You have the power to change your perceptions. But nothing else.

data.author: Epictetus
data.title: What do we value? Externals. What do we look after? Externals. So of course we are going to experience fear and nervousness.
paragraphs: One of the main principles of stoic philosophy is to always have in mind what is within your control and what is not. Epictetus says to put the ideas in action that protect against attachment to externals such as individual people places or institutions - even your own body.
You only have power over your perceptions. Forget the rest.

data.author: Seneca
data.title: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that things are difficult.
paragraphs: The avoidance of pain will only lead to greater pain down the road. Therefore you must deal with emotions and thoughts as soon as they arise. To do this you have to be highly aware meditative at all times.
It is not possible to do this with a tired or dull mind. A mind that is drugged with alcohol or weighed down by an overweight body.
You've heard the saying before a healthy body is a healthy mind. It is all connected. You can only have an attentive sharp mind if you take care of both.

How do you become highly aware and meditative? You have to take the time to sit with your own thoughts and emotions. To watch them and understand them. To not get caught up with any particular beliefs.
But meditation isn't withdrawal from life. Real life is all about your relationship with people and material goods.
Watch your reactions carefully when you're talking to someone. Are you even listening to the other person or are you thinking about what you're going to say next?
Meditation is total awareness.

data.author: Epictetus
data.title: Let somebody suffering from indigestion ask me whether vinegar is useful I will say yes. So is it useful to me? To you no.
paragraphs: Don't learn philosophy to lecture other people on how to live. Everybody has their own circumstances. Don't just learn philosophy to say that you've read the books. Read it to fix yourself.
All of you first attend to your own wounds stanch the bleeding calm your mind - Epictetus

data.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
data.title: If your eyes are blinded with your worries you cannot see the beauty of the sunset.
paragraphs: When you look at a tree do you really truly see it as it actually is? Or are you only seeing it through a cloud of thought things you've been taught?
Does the word tree pop into your head? Thoughts of scientific ideas such as photosynthesis and the different gasses involved?
We are really just second-hand people living off what people have told us. We never discover things by ourselves.
So can you not just see it simply for what it is right there in front of you?

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.title: Man is spurred on by desire and greed to be always wanting greater gratification. Lau Tzu believed it is necessary to keep a very close watch on these desires. To counter these natural tendencies with the lessons of knowing contentment and knowing when to stop.
paragraphs: Man is spurred on by desire and greed to be always wanting greater gratification. Lau Tzu believed it is necessary to keep a very close watch on these desires. To counter these natural tendencies with the lessons of knowing contentment and knowing when to stop.
To understand these lessons means to live contentfully knowing you have everything you need in this present moment.
He who knows contentment is rich.

Desire can be good. Without desire you would have no wants to gain a better understanding of the world or yourself. But desire narrows focus. If you are always desiring more then you are not content. You won't be able to look around be present and appreciate what you have. You can only see the mysteries of the world by not desiring.
You must live the paradox of trying and not trying; learning and letting go of learning. Knowing when to stop and be content.
There is no crime greater than having too many desires;
There is no disaster greater than not being content;
There is no misfortune greater than being covetous.
We dislike uncertainty as it implies our lives could be at risk. But to embrace uncertainty is to live joyfully and at peace with what is.
Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking the whole world belongs to you.

data.author: Soren Kierkegaard
data.title: Life is not a problem to be solved but a reality to be experienced.
paragraphs: Productivity has become the buzz word. If you aren't being productive then you are wasting your time.
University students today are struggling. High rates of depression and anxiety. They know that they should take time out to relax but they can't relax.
They take time to go to the beach or for a few evening drinks with friends and at the back of their minds is how much time they are wasting.
Realise that you don't actually have to do anything. All that matters is what you're doing now. You can deal with all the other stuff when you actually get to it.
But right now you're studying or you're relaxing; reading or watching a movie.
Be present. You can deal with the other stuff when it's time.

data.author: Seneca
data.title: Whenever you want to know whether the desire aroused in you by something you are pursuing is natural or quite unseeing ask yourself whether it is capable of coming to rest at any point; if after going a long way there is always something remaining farther away be sure it is not something natural.

If you shape your life according to nature you will never be poor; if according to people's opinions you will never be rich. - Epicurus

Fancy ornaments and a nice car will only induce in you a craving for even bigger things. When feeling anxious find the desire(s) causing it and put them under the scrutiny of rational thought and philosophy.

paragraphs: Desire is a contract that you make with yourself to be unhappy until you get what you want. Have this in mind when you are unhappy and ask yourself what is the underlying desire that I have that is not being fulfilled?
You're a living thing. You have desires. Don't just pick them up randomly or unconsciously. I wish I lived somewhere warmer or I wish I earned as much as him.
Pick your one overwhelming desire and forget the rest. It's OK to suffer over that one. Let the rest go.

It's a new kind of action one that is free from mental slavery. A total action. Completely free and filled with joy.

A clear mind and so happiness come about by perceiving things positively.

data.title: One day you may catch yourself smiling at the voice in your head as you would smile at the antics of a child. This means that you no longer take the content of your mind all that seriously as your sense of self does not depend on it.
paragraphs: An interesting idea to stop identifying with your thoughts: give your mind a name

This is very interesting because as you give your mind a name suddenly it seems as if you are watching some other creature that is not you. This gives you the space to watch and not identify with your mind. Do you have disturbing thought X? Well Paul youre being quite a busy bee arent you?
This is a good practice from ACT (Acceptance and commitment therapy). I recommend you try it.

We often suffer because we identify a lot with our mind and its disturbing thoughts. We think this is US and that they are true. As a result we feel bad. But they just occur to us. By giving your mind a name it creates more space and you learn to take your thoughts with a large grain of salt. We are so accustomed to believing our every thought and belief. By giving our mind a name we can watch it more objectively as if we were in a laboratory.
Thoughts are nothing personal at all and frankly rarely true. They just happen. Building this awareness is liberating. The mind has its own agenda. Get some popcorn and let the watching begin!

But people don't take responsibility for their happiness. If you don't take responsibility for your diet then you'll become overweight malnourished and diseased.

If you don't take responsibility for your happiness then you'll never be happy. There will always be someone else to blame - society or your parents and you'll never do anything about it because you believe it's out of your hands.
The first step to becoming happy is believing that it's possible. Choose to become happy.

What are your conditions for happiness? Perhaps you think you need to have nice supportive parents and 5 close friends that you can share anything with and will always stand by you. Plenty of money so you can have a nice house in a nice neighbourhood. A partner and two intelligent children. The list may be endless.
Life can't guarantee this. And if you have it it can all be taken away in an instance.
If you depend on anything other than yourself for your happiness then you will never have any.

data.author: Naval Ravikant
data.title: Ruminating on the past is largely a waste of time. It's illusory.
paragraphs: Living in the past causes depression. As you sit reading this in this present moment everything is fine.
Look around you. Is anything that terrible happening in front of you? The trouble is in your head. This might be difficult to hear for some people but denying the truth will get you nowhere.
You sit in this present moment with images and movie clips of events that happened in the past playing in your mind. All of it an illusion. None of it real or true. Just made up stuff in your head.

You may argue back and say that it is true because it actually did happen. But really it's just your perception of what happened mutated each time it's recalled by whatever emotions that you feel at the time.

So you sit in the present moment with no problems. A thought then comes to mind and reminds you of a time you got drunk and embarrassed yourself in front of your family or that you failed an exam and it reminds you that you're a loser. You become sad your energy drops and you want to escape from this pain somehow - TV video games alcohol.

Try sitting with these thoughts and emotions. Watch them. Watch the thoughts that are judging and condemning your thoughts without saying no I shouldn't think like that. But even if you do think that watch it. Let it happen.

You feel bored or anxious don't escape it watch it learn about it. See the truth of it. The truth being the actual thing as it is just the feeling of anxiety without trying to escape or correct it. You will find that it dissipates naturally.

data.author: Eckhart Tolle
data.title: When you listen to that voice listen to it impartially - don't judge or condemn what you hear for doing so would mean that the same voice has come in again through the backdoor.
paragraphs: In watching the thought you gain a deeper consciousness. You are not only aware of the thought but also yourself witnessing the thought.

You see that your true self lies beneath the thought. You no longer identify with the thought - you're not defined by it. It isn't you. Therefore the thought loses its power over you as it's no longer fuelled by the mind identifying with it. The thought dissipates. The mind becomes still at peace.
Joy of being comes out of this tranquillity. This is the essence of meditation.

data.author: Seneca
data.title: One's life should be a compromise between the ideal and the popular morality. People should admire our way of life but they should at the same time find it understandable.
paragraphs: I am not a fan of the word enlightenment. It suggests some super-human accomplishment - you've transcended and found some superior way of living. It isn't healthy to see yourself as separate from society as better than it.

You can think and behave differently to society but you still have to be a part of it. The goal is not to alienate yourself. Living peacefully isn't some renunciation from society and material things. That isn't living at all. Seeing yourself as not part of society will only create fear and anxiety.
All enlightenment really means is that you have a quiet and peaceful mind. That you have found your true nature beyond name and form.
This is a beautiful thing. It means the end of suffering. It means dying to the past every moment in time to be completely present.

paragraphs: The tale of two monks and a woman is on old Buddhist parable. It goes something like this:

Two monks were walking along the side of a river when they hear the cries of a woman. My house is across this river I crossed it to gather berries this morning. It rained heavily and I can't swim please can you help me cross!
The larger monk said sure I'll carry you across we're heading that way anyway. He carried her over the river and the girl thanked them.
Later that evening the shorter monk sighs I can't get this out of my mind but you have sinned. As monks we took a vow to never touch a woman.
The larger monk replies you may be right but I dropped her off 2 hours ago. You are still carrying her aren't you?

data.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
data.title: Meditation is to be aware of every thought and of every feeling never to say it is right or wrong but just to watch it and move with it.
paragraphs: We judge and condemn every emotion and thought that we have and this analysis never gets us anywhere. We live inside our own heads with our silly beliefs and when the world doesn't conform to our beliefs it hurts us.

We get angry at someone for cutting in front of us on the freeway but we justify it and say it was acceptable anger. They were in the wrong. But then we think how dumb it was getting angry over something not in our control. Now you're angry at yourself!

Someone gets more than you think they deserve and you become jealous. A past event didn't go your way and you feel depressed. You have an exam in two days and you've studied hard. You think you deserve to do well but the future is uncertain so you become anxious. All this trouble caused from having ideals and beliefs in our minds.
This is the point of meditation. It is to be aware and see things how they truly are with no ideals or conclusions.
Blue skies trees and the TV are all real things. So are your thoughts - your judgements and beliefs. So can you just look at them without any effort to stop them or justify them?
Can you also watch the thoughts that are judging and condemning your thoughts? The ones that say I am meditating so I should not be thinking so much. Can you watch those too?
If you can then you'll find that they will dissipate naturally by themselves. Offer resistance and they will take root in your mind.

Grab a chair or sit on the floor it doesn't matter. Sit up alert - this isn't about falling asleep - but comfortable. Close your eyes and sit with yourself. Just your thoughts and emotions for company. Let whatever happens happen. No censor.
Meditation is simply the art of doing nothing - Naval Ravikant.

data.author: James Clear
data.title: The cost of your bad habits is in the future; the cost of your good habits is in the present.
paragraphs: Your negative emotions do not have to persist. This does not mean that they will disappear but rather that you have it within your control to not linger on them.

Imagine for a moment that you are stuck in a particular emotion. Maybe someone has made you angry and you find it difficult to shake the feeling. You do this by ruminating on the reason why you are justified to feel the way you do. You have perfectly valid reasons for being angry after all. Your mental state is completely occupied by the sense of anger when your phone rings. This forces you to immediately put on your best social face. Youve switched to a new state of mind. Most of the time well immediately switch back to our prior state of negative emotion once the call is hung up.

A positive change can start by becoming aware of the sudden changes in our mental states that may occur throughout the day. You are depressed but moved to laughter by something you read. You are bored and impatient in traffic but then cheered by a call from a close friend.

Simply noticing that paying attention to something else changes your state of mind can offer a true glimpse of freedom. You will start realizing how temporary your emotions are how very fragile their state of existence really is. Your emotions are really nothing but a constant rolling of one emotional wave after another. There is freedom in realizing that it is futile to attempt to hold on to any of them.

The practice of noticing can start by paying close attention to the negative feelings themselves without judgement or resistance. What is anger? Where do you feel it in your body? How is it arising in each moment? And what is it that is aware of the feeling itself? Peering inward with mindfulness can lead to your discovery that negative states of mind vanish all by themselves.

data.author: Naval Ravikant
data.title: All that exists is this moment; it's all there is. There is no future. That's a fiction in your head that... nobody can predict the future. There is no past; nobody's gone back even an inch in their past not even a second so that doesn't exist.
paragraphs: We have discovered that the past is just an illusion. A distraction from the present moment - the only thing that there ever truly is.
We found that living in the past is the cause of our depression sorrow sadness and zaps away our energy.

We also think about the future. But the future is really just the past projected. Our brain is a physical thing that stores memories and facts that we have accumulated from past experiences and events.
We then use these memories to project and predict what will happen in the future. So if the past is an illusion and the future is just the past projected then it is also just an illusion.
Thinking about the past causes depression. Thinking about the future causes anxiety.
Why do we think of the future? Fundamentally it comes down to fear of uncertainty. We have beliefs and physical things that we are attached to and we are scared to lose them.

We fear not becoming something or someone. Becoming a great engineer or lawyer. We fear never being loved or for the health of our children. We fear being rejected or ridiculed of not fitting in. What are your fears?
Fear is within us all. It is not something that we can escape from we have evolved with it for millions of years. So can you watch that fear get to know it become intimate with it?
As we discussed there are many reasons for feeling fear. But can you go past the reasons? Past all your justifications for fear and see the root of the problem: fear itself.
Be totally aware of everything going on externally and internally. Mediation is not concentration - focusing on breath or some particular thing.
It's a total awareness. Let everything flow. Meditation should be effortless.

data.author: Eckhart Tolle
data.title: The mind is a superb instrument if used rightly. Used wrongly however it becomes very destructive. To put it more accurately it is not so much that you use your mind wrongly - you usually don't use it at all. It uses you. This is the disease. You believe that you are your mind. This is the delusion. The instrument has taken over you.
paragraphs: A noisy mind means you are identified with it. You are a slave to your mind. It is like you are possessed without even knowing it and you take this possessing entity to be yourself.

Freedom begins when you realise that you are not this possessing entity and you start to watch it. It is then you can see that there is a whole new area of consciousness above that of thought. There is a vast field of intelligence beyond thoughts and concepts.
All things that truly matter - love joy peace - arise from beyond the mind.
